com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware

Class Gamepad

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qualcomm.robotcore.robocol.RobocolParsableBase
      • com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.Gamepad
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RobocolParsable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LogitechGamepadF310, MicrosoftGamepadXbox360

    public class Gamepad
extends RobocolParsableBase
    Represents the state of a joystick attached to the driver station. Values for all the buttons and sticks are stored in fields of the object. Fields should be treated as read-only.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Gamepad.GamepadCallback
      Optional callback interface for monitoring changes due to MotionEvents and KeyEvents.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.qualcomm.robotcore.robocol.RobocolParsable

        RobocolParsable.MsgType

    • Field Detail

      • ID_UNASSOCIATED

        public static final int ID_UNASSOCIATED
        The value of id if neither Start+A or Start+B has been pressed yet
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • left_stick_x

        public float left_stick_x
        The left joystick's x position. -1 indicates all the way to the left, 0 indicates in the middle, and 1 indicates all the way to the right.

      • left_stick_y

        public float left_stick_y
        The left joystick's y position. -1 indicates all the way up, 0 indicates in the middle, and 1 indicates all the way down.

      • right_stick_x

        public float right_stick_x
        The right joystick's x position. -1 indicates all the way to the left, 0 indicates in the middle, and 1 indicates all the way to the right.

      • right_stick_y

        public float right_stick_y
        The right joystick's y position. -1 indicates all the way up, 0 indicates in the middle, and 1 indicates all the way down.

      • dpad_up

        public boolean dpad_up
        Whether the D-pad is being pushed up. true indicates that the D-pad is either in the up-left, up, or up-right positions; false indicates that it isn't.

      • dpad_down

        public boolean dpad_down
        Whether the D-pad is being pushed down. true indicates that the D-pad is either in the down-left, down, or down-right positions; false indicates that it isn't.

      • dpad_left

        public boolean dpad_left
        Whether the D-pad is being pushed left. true indicates that the D-pad is either in the up-left, left, or down-left positions; false indicates that it isn't.

      • dpad_right

        public boolean dpad_right
        Whether the D-pad is being pushed right. true indicates that the D-pad is either in the up-right, right, or down-right positions; false indicates that it isn't.

      • a

        public boolean a
        Whether the A button (bottom on right side) is being pressed. true if pressed, false if unpressed.

      • b

        public boolean b
        Whether the B button (right on right side) is being pressed. true if pressed, false if unpressed.

      • x

        public boolean x
        Whether the X button (left on right side) is being pressed. true if pressed, false if unpressed.

      • y

        public boolean y
        Whether the Y button (top on right side) is being pressed. true if pressed, false if unpressed.

      • guide

        public boolean guide
        Whether the button in the center of the joystick is being pressed. This button is between BACK and START on the F310 gamepad. true if pressed, false if unpressed. The OS may capture this button before it is sent to the app; in which case you'll never receive it.

      • start

        public boolean start
        Whether the start button is being pressed. This button is the one above the right stick on the F310 gamepad. true if pressed, false if unpressed.

      • back

        public boolean back
        Whether the back button is being pressed. This button is the one above the left stick on the F310 gamepad. true if pressed, false if unpressed.

      • left_bumper

        public boolean left_bumper
        Whether the left bumper is being pressed. This is the top button on the left front of the F310 gamepad. true if pressed, false if unpressed.

      • right_bumper

        public boolean right_bumper
        Whether the right bumper is being pressed. This is the top button on the right front of the F310 gamepad. true if pressed, false if unpressed.

      • left_stick_button

        public boolean left_stick_button
        Whether the left stick is being pressed in. true if pressed, false if unpressed.

      • right_stick_button

        public boolean right_stick_button
        Whether the right stick is being pressed in. true if pressed, false if unpressed.

      • left_trigger

        public float left_trigger
        How much the left trigger is being pressed. This is the bottom button on the left front of the F310 Gamepad. 0 if unpressed, 1 if fully pressed.

      • right_trigger

        public float right_trigger
        How much the right trigger is being pressed. This is the bottom button on the right front of the F310 Gamepad. 0 if unpressed, 1 if fully pressed.

      • user

        public byte user
        Value depends on whether it is registered as the first or second joystick

      • id

        public int id
        ID assigned to this gamepad by the OS. This value can change each time the device is plugged in.

      • timestamp

        public long timestamp
        The value of System.nanoTime() when event was last detected

    • Constructor Detail

      • Gamepad

        public Gamepad()

      • Gamepad

        public Gamepad(Gamepad.GamepadCallback callback)
        Constructs a Gamepad that will call the specified method when values change. This occurs any time button or stick value changes (but not necessarily once for each changed value) and also when calling fromByteArray(byte[]).
        Parameters:
        callback - contains the method to call upon receiving new values

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        public void copy(Gamepad gamepad)
          throws RobotCoreException
        Copy the state of a gamepad into this gamepad
        Parameters:
        gamepad - state to be copied from
        Throws:
        RobotCoreException - if the copy fails - gamepad will be in an unknown state if this exception is thrown

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets this gamepad's values to the default state. There is no guarantee that the values will not be set to another value before the user tries to access them.

      • setJoystickDeadzone

        public void setJoystickDeadzone(float deadzone)
        Changes the "deadzone" of the analog sticks. If the stick values read less than the deadzone value, they will be set to 0. If the stick values read greater than the deadzone value, they will be scaled from the range [deadzone, 1.0] to [0.0, 1.0].
        Parameters:
        deadzone - a number between 0 and 1 to set as the deadzone

      • update

        public void update(android.view.MotionEvent event)
        Updates the stick, trigger, and D-pad values based on the new state. It is not advised for the user to call this method.
        Parameters:
        event - the event specifiying the new joystick values

      • update

        public void update(android.view.KeyEvent event)
        Updates the button and D-pad values based on the new state. It is not advised for the user to call this method.
        Parameters:
        event - the event specifiying the new set of buttons being pressed

      • getRobocolMsgType

        public RobocolParsable.MsgType getRobocolMsgType()
        Returns the type of data being transmitted to the driver station when this object is converted to a byte array and sent
        Returns:
        MsgType.GAMEPAD

      • toByteArray

        public byte[] toByteArray()
                   throws RobotCoreException
        Converts the state into a byte array
        Returns:
        a byte array storing the value of every field
        Throws:
        RobotCoreException

      • fromByteArray

        public void fromByteArray(byte[] byteArray)
                   throws RobotCoreException
        Makes this instance take on the state specified by a byte array.
        Parameters:
        byteArray - a byte array (presumably generated by toByteArray())
        Throws:
        RobotCoreException
        See Also:
        toByteArray()

      • atRest

        public boolean atRest()
        Returns whether all the sticks and triggers are at rest. If the sticks are within the set deadzones, they count as being at rest.
        Returns:
        true iff every stick and trigger is in its equilibrium position (or sufficiently close)

      • type

        public java.lang.String type()
        Get the type of gamepad as a String. This method defaults to "Standard".
        Returns:
        gamepad type

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Display a summary of this gamepad, including the state of all buttons, analog sticks, and triggers
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a summary

      • enableWhitelistFilter

        public static void enableWhitelistFilter(int vendorId,
                                         int productId)
        Add a whitelist filter for a specific device vendor/product ID.

        This adds a whitelist to the gamepad detection method. If a device has been added to the whitelist, then only devices that match the given vendor ID and product ID will be considered gamepads. This method can be called multiple times to add multiple devices to the whitelist.

        If no whitelist entries have been added, then the default OS detection methods will be used.

        Parameters:
        vendorId - the vendor ID
        productId - the product ID

      • clearWhitelistFilter

        public static void clearWhitelistFilter()
        Clear the device whitelist filter.

      • isGamepadDevice

        public static boolean isGamepadDevice(int deviceId)
        Does this device ID belong to a gamepad device?
        Parameters:
        deviceId - device ID
        Returns:
        true, if gamepad device; false otherwise
